paper_title.en: Asymmetric reduction of ketones with a germinated plant

description.en: A germinated radish sprout was used as a novel type of biocatalyst for the asymmetric reduction of ketones. The reactions proceeded with high enantioselectivities (>99% ee). The biocatalyst is easily obtainable from commercially available vegetable seeds and is very easy to use. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

publication_name.ja: バイオインダストリー

paper_title.ja: Control of chemoselectivity of microbial reaction with resin adsorbent: enhancement of Baeyer-Villiger oxidation over reduction
paper_title.en: Control of chemoselectivity of microbial reaction with resin adsorbent : enhancement of Baeyer-Villiger oxidation over reduction

description.en: Recent developments of biocatalytic reduction of carbonyl groups are reviewed. Methods to find, prepare and modify the biocatalysts and to improve productivity and enantioselectivity of the reactions are explained. Then, practical applications for the asymmetric reduction of carbonyl compounds with various functionalities are given, including the synthesis of pharmaceutically important compounds. © 2006 Bentham Science Publishers Ltd.

paper_title.ja: 成長光条件の異なるブロッコリースプラウトが腸管上皮細胞からのIL-7・TGF-分泌に及ぼす影響
Chemoenzymatic synthesis of optically active c-alkyl-c-butenolides

paper_title.en: Rate enhancement of lipase-catalyzed reaction in supercritical carbon dioxide

description.en: Lipase-catalyzed kinetic resolution of various 1-arylethanols was performed in supercritical carbon dioxide (scCO(2)), in hexane and without solvent. The use of scCO(2) enhances reactivity especially when a cross-linked enzyme aggregate (CLEA) was used.

paper_title.en: Supercritical carbon dioxide as a reaction medium for enzymatic kinetic resolution of P-chiral hydroxymethanephosphinates

description.en: Kinetic resolution of racemic P-chiral hydroxymethanephosphinates via their lipase-promoted acetylation in supercritical carbon dioxide as the reaction medium was for the first time investigated Under various conditions. The reactivity and selectivity could be controlled by changing the pressure. (c) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Supercritical carbon dioxide as a reaction medium for enzymatic kinetic resolution of P-chiral hydroxymethanephosphinates

description.en: Kinetic resolution of racemic P-chiral hydroxymethanephosphinates via their lipase-promoted acetylation in supercritical carbon dioxide as the reaction medium was for the first time investigated Under various conditions. The reactivity and selectivity could be controlled by changing the pressure. (c) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

The reduction of the carbonyl group in 3-acetylisoxazole derivatives by algae (Cyanobacterium: Synechococcus elongatus PCC 7942 and Synechosystis sp. PCC 6803) and plant cells (Caragana chamlagu) gave the corresponding (S)-alcohols with high enantioselectivities. (c) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

The reduction of the carbonyl group in 3-acetylisoxazole derivatives by algae (Cyanobacterium: Synechococcus elongatus PCC 7942 and Synechosystis sp. PCC 6803) and plant cells (Caragana chamlagu) gave the corresponding (S)-alcohols with high enantioselectivities. (c) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Asymmetric synthesis using hydrolytic enzymes in supercritical carbon dioxide

description.en: The use of hydrolytic enzymes in supercritical carbon dioxide (scCO(2)), an environmentally friendly solvent with many uses, is an attractive approach to asymmetric synthesis: several examples are reviewed here. (C) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Asymmetric synthesis using hydrolytic enzymes in supercritical carbon dioxide.

paper_title.en: Rate Enhancement of Lipase-catalyzed Reaction in Supercritical Carbon Dioxide
Enzymatic reactions in supercritical CO2: carboxylation, asymmetric reduction and esterification

description.en: Catalytic reactions in supercritical CO2 have been receiving increased attention during the last decade. This report reviews enzymatic reactions in supercritical CO2 such as carboxylation of pyrrole by a decarboxylase, asymmetric reduction of ketones by an alcohol dehydrogenase and enantioselective esterification of a trifluoromethyl alcohol by a lipase. (C) 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

Reduction of (+)- and (-)-camphorquinones (1a, 1b) by cyanobacteria (Synechococcus elongatus PCC 7942 and Synechosystis sp. PCC 6803) under illumination gave alpha-hydroxycamphor selectively. It was found that (+)-camphorquinone was reduced to give (-)-3S- exohydroxycamphor as major product in high stereoselectivity and the stereoselectivity decreased in the dark. (C) 2004 Elsevier B. V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: High-efficiency and minimum-waste continuous kinetic resolution of racemic alcohols by using lipase in supercritical carbon dioxide

description.en: A novel continuous-flow scCO(2) process for kinetic resolution of racemic alcohols can be performed with an immobilized lipase to lead to a quantitative mixture of the corresponding optically active acetates with up to 99% ee and unreacted alcohols with up to 99% ee, in which the productivity of the optically active compounds was improved by over 400 times compared to the corresponding batch reaction using scCO(2).
